hackathon-description-text: Thank you very much to all who participated in the challenge!  The results were phenomenal and listed below are the winners:

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Associate Professor of Public Administration and Director, Center for Applied Community Research and Development
Associate Professor, Computer Science, Binghamton University
Director of Community Impact and Engagement, United Way of Broome County
Executive Director, Community Foundation for South Central New York

hackathon-requirements: Challenges will be issues that local non-profits face on a daily basis.  Participants can pick which challenge they work on.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: There will a first prize for each challenge posted, and one overall price for "most technically impressive".

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=85 Murray Hill Road, Binghamton University, Vestal, NY 13850, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: There will be a total of (7) judges.  Each judge will select their first, second and third place choices, with corresponding points assigned.  The teams with the most points will win their challenge.

hackathon-location-address: 85 Murray Hill Road, Binghamton University, Vestal, NY 13850, USA
hackathon-description-header: Want to make a difference?  Come to Binghamton University's Coding for A Cause hackathon on Saturday, November 1, 2014.
